member.name: T:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor
member.summary: A compressor processes input image data (either from a or just raw image data) using the Nvidia Texture Tools API and outputs either to a file (e.g. DDS) or to memory (e.g. ). Processing can range from mipmap creation (with a variety of filters) to compressing RGBA data into a number of GPU compressed formats.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.Process(TeximpNet.DDS.DDSContainer@)
member.summary: Executes processing of input image data, and outputs the images as a . In the case of cubemap textures, each cubemap face will have its own mipmap chain, in the order of (+X, -X, +Y, -Y, +Z, -Z).
member.param: Container that contains all the processed images. May be null if the operation was not successful.
member.returns: True if the image was successfully processed and outputted to a container, false if otherwise.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions
member.summary: Options for setting up input to a .
member.remarks: Input image data can be set from objects or from raw IntPtr memory (format is always expected to be BGRA, 8-bits per channel). There are some methods that can set both the texture layout and all the first mip surfaces in one call, but the user can optionally set the texture layout and then set each individual face and miplevel. In most cases the first mip level gets set and mipmaps are generated, but there are other cases where mipmaps are already present and the will use them during compression or normal map generation. If mipmaps aren't set explicitly and normal maps are generated, the first mip is converted to a normal map, and mipmaps are generated from that.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.NativePtr
member.summary: Gets the pointer to the native object.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.TextureType
member.summary: Gets the texture type of the input image.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.Width
member.summary: Gets the width of the input image.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.Height
member.summary: Gets the height of the input image.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.Depth
member.summary: Gets the depth of the input image. (Typically 1 if not 3D).

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.FaceCount
member.summary: Gets the number of faces in the input image. If a 2D image then this is always one, if a cubemap then this is 6 faces (one for each side of the cube). This may be greater than one if the type is a 2D array texture (similar to cubemap, but variable # of faces). Cubemap arrays are not supported.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.MipmapCount
member.summary: Gets the number of mipmaps that will be generated for each face.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.GenerateMipmaps
member.summary: Gets or sets if mipmaps should be generated. The max level of mips will be set if mipmaps are to be generated. By default this is true.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.AlphaMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the alpha mode that will be used during processing. By default this is .

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.RoundMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the round mode that will be used during processing. By default this is .

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.MaxTextureExtent
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum texture dimensions, used in conjunction with . By default this is set to zero.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.MipmapFilter
member.summary: Gets or sets the filter used during mipmap generation. By default this is .

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.WrapMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the wrap mode used during mipmap generation. By default this is set to .

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.IsNormalMap
member.summary: Gets or sets if the input image is to be treated as a normal map. By default this is false.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.NormalizeMipmaps
member.summary: Gets or sets if the mipmaps of a normal map should be renormalized after they are generated. By default this is true.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.ConvertToNormalMap
member.summary: Gets or sets if the input image should be converted to a normal map.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.HasData
member.summary: Gets if the input has mipmap data, this will be true/false depending on the success of the functions to set any mipmap data. All mipmap faces (1 for Texture2D, 6 for TextureCube) need to be set for the compressor to run.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.SetTextureLayout(TeximpNet.Compression.TextureType,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the layout of the input image.
member.param: Type of texture the input image is.
Optional depth of the input image, only valid for 3D textures, by default this is 1.
Optional array count, only valid for 2D array textures (cubemap arrays are not supported), by default this is 1.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.ClearTextureLayout
member.summary: Clears the current input image data and texture layout. This frees any image data that the input options holds onto.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.SetMipmapData(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean,TeximpNet.Compression.ImageInfo)
member.summary: Sets image data as input. Format is always considered to be a 32-bit BGRA form, if in RGBA ordering, a copy of the data will be taken and re-ordered. Don't forget to call first, other this will error.
member.param: Image data, assumed to be either 32-bit BGRA or RGBA format.
True if the data is BGRA ordering, false if RGBA ordering.
Information describing image details such as dimension.
member.returns: True if the data has been set, false if otherwise.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.SetMipmapData(TeximpNet.Surface,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets 2D image data as input. Format is always considered to be a 32-bit BGRA form (a copy of the surface will be taken to convert if necessary), the color order is dependent on . Don't forget to call first, other this will error.
member.param: Bitmap surface, if not 32-bit RGBA, a copy will be taken and converted.
Which mipmap level the image corresponds to.
Which array index the image corresponds to.
member.returns: True if the data has been set, false if otherwise.

member.param: Bitmap surface, if not 32-bit RGBA, a copy will be taken and converted.
Which cubemap face the image corresponds to.
Which mipmap level the image corresponds to.
member.returns: True if the data has been set, false if otherwise.

True if the data is BGRA ordering, false if RGBA ordering.
Which mipmap level the image corresponds to.
Which array index the image corresponds to.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.SetData(TeximpNet.Surface)
member.summary: Sets input data from a specified surface. This sets the texture layout as a 2D texture and the first mipmap with the surface data.
member.param: Bitmap surface data, if not 32-bit RGBA, a copy will be taken and converted.
member.returns: True if the data has been set, false if otherwise.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.InputOptions.SetData(TeximpNet.Surface[])
member.summary: Sets input data from an array of surfaces representing a cubemap (6 surfaces total). This sets the texture layout as a cubemap and sets each surface as the first mipmap of each face. All the surface dimensions must match, and there must be six faces.
member.param: Array of bitmap surfaces, in the order of the enum (+X, -X, +Y, -Y, +Z, -Z). If surfaces are not 32-bit RGBA, a copy will be taken and converted..
member.returns: True if the data has been set, false if otherwise.

member.summary: Sets input data from a specified surface. This sets the texture layout as a 2D or 3D texture depending on the dimensions of the surface. and the first mipmap with the surface data.
member.param: Bitmap surface data, if not 32-bit RGBA, a copy will be taken and converted.
True if the data is BGRA ordering, false if RGBA ordering.
member.returns: True if the data has been set, false if otherwise.

member.returns: True if the data has been set, false if otherwise.

Mask for the bits that correspond to the red channel.

member.summary: Sets the color output format if no block compression is set to RGBA format rather than BGRA format. Essentially this sets the masks so red and blue values are swapped.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Compression.Compressor.CompressionOptions.SetQuantization(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets whether the compressor should do dithering before compression or during quantiziation. When using block compression this does not generally improve the quality of the output image, but in some cases it can produce smoother results. It is generally a good idea to enable dithering when the output format is RGBA color.
member.param: True to enable color dithering, false otherwise.
True to enable alpha dithering false otherwise.
True to use binary alpha, false otherwise.

member.summary: Gets the current quantiziation parameters.
member.param: True to enable color dithering, false otherwise.
True to enable alpha dithering false otherwise.
True to use binary alpha, false otherwise.

member.summary: Sets color weighting during compression. By default the compression error is measured for each channel uniformly, but for some images it may make more sense to measure the error in a perceptual color space.
member.param: Weight for the red channel, default is 1.0.
Weight for the green channel, default is 1.0.
Weight for the blue channel, default is 1.0.
Weight for the alpha channel, default is 1.0.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat
member.summary: Enumerates output formats for the .

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.BGRA
member.summary: Output in a non-compressed color format. By setting the pixel layout both RGBA and BGRA order or any arbitrary pixel format is possible.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.DXT1
member.summary: Default block compression format (same as ). By default the implicit 1 bit alpha channel is not used and is always opaque.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.DXT1a
member.summary: Variation of that supports a 1 bit alpha channel.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.DXT3
member.summary: Block compression format similar to but with an explicit 3 bit alpha channel.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.DXT5
member.summary: Block compression format similar to but with a compressed alpha block.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.DXT5n
member.summary: Variation of that is used to represent normal maps by encoding the X and Y components as follows: R=1, G=Y, B=0, A=X. This swizzle is used to faciliate decompression using "Capcon's DXT decompression trick" (https://code.google.com/archive/p/nvidia-texture-tools/wikis/NormalMapCompression.wiki#Capcon%27s_DXT_trick).

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.BC1
member.summary: Default block compression format. By default the implicit 1 bit alpha channel is not used and is always opaque.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.BC1a
member.summary: Variation of that supports a 1 bit alpha channel.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.BC2
member.summary: Block compression format similar to but with an explicit 3 bit alpha channel.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.BC3
member.summary: Block compression format similar to but with a compressed alpha block.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.BC3n
member.summary: Variation of that is used to represent normal maps by encoding the X and Y components as follows: R=1, G=Y, B=0, A=X. This swizzle is used to faciliate decompression using "Capcon's DXT decompression trick" (https://code.google.com/archive/p/nvidia-texture-tools/wikis/NormalMapCompression.wiki#Capcon%27s_DXT_trick).

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.BC4
member.summary: Block compression format that only contains a single alpha block.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.BC5
member.summary: Block compression format that contains two alpha blocks. It's typically used to compress normal maps.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.BC6
member.summary: Block compression format for HDR textures, that supports 3 color channels each "half floating point" (16 bits).

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.BC7
member.summary: Block compression format that has three color channels (4-7 bits per channel) and transparency (0-8 bits for alpha).

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.BC3_RGBM
member.summary: Variation of that is used to compress HDR textures.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.ETC1
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression format with 3 color channels and no transparency. Commonly used for mobile devices.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.ETC2_R
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression with only red channel. Commonly used for mobile devices.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.ETC2_RG
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression with only red/green channel. Commonly used for mobile devices.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.ETC2_RGB
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression with 3 color channels and no transparency Commonly used for mobile devices.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.ETC2_RGBA
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression with 3 color channels and transparency. Commonly used for mobile devices.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.ETC2_RGB_A1
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression with 3 color channels and 1-bit alpha channel. Commonly used for mobile devices.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.ETC2_RGBM
member.summary: Ericsson Texture Compression for HDR textures with 3 color channels. Commonly used for mobile devices.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.PVR_2BPP_RGB
member.summary: PVRTC compression format, with 2 bits per pixel and no transparency. Commonly used for mobile devices.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.PVR_4BPP_RGB
member.summary: PVRTC compression format, with 4 bits per pixel and no transparency. Commonly used for mobile devices.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.PVR_2BPP_RGBA
member.summary: PVRTC compression format, with 2 bits per pixel and transparency. Commonly used for mobile devices.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionFormat.PVR_4BPP_RGBA
member.summary: PVRTC compression format, with 4 bits per pixel and transparency. Commonly used for mobile devices.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.Compression.WrapMode
member.summary: Enumerates what happens when evaluating the color of texels near an image's border during mipmap generation, as most filters will sample outside the texture.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.WrapMode.Clamp
member.summary: Sampling outside texture range will use the color at the border.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.WrapMode.Repeat
member.summary: Repeats the texture when sampling outside the texture. E.g. sample between 1 and 2 UV is the same as sampling between 0 and 1 UV.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.WrapMode.Mirror
member.summary: Repeats the texture, but flips the image. E.g. sample between 0 and 1 UV is normal but sampling between 1 and 2 UV the texture is flipped (mirrored). This is the default option.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.Compression.TextureType
member.summary: Enumerates texture layouts for input data.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.TextureType.Texture2D
member.summary: Input data is a 2D texture.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.TextureType.TextureCube
member.summary: Input data is a Cubemap, which has 6 faces, where each face is a 2D texture.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.TextureType.Texture3D
member.summary: Input data is a 3D texture.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.TextureType.Texture2DArray
member.summary: Input data is an array of 2D textures that share the same width/height.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.Compression.MipmapFilter
member.summary: Enumerates filter algorithms used by the for mipmap generation.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.MipmapFilter.Box
member.summary: A polyphase box filter. It's the default option and good choice for most cases. It's also much faster than the other filters.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.MipmapFilter.Triangle
member.summary: A filter that has a larger width and thus produces blurrier results than the box filter.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.MipmapFilter.Kaiser
member.summary: A kaiser-windowed sinc filter that is generally considered the best choice for downsampling filters.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionQuality
member.summary: Enumerates quality of compressing image data.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionQuality.Fastest
member.summary: Least quality, but fastest processing time. Results may be reasonable, but is not considered to be real-time either.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionQuality.Normal
member.summary: Default quality, balanced in terms of quality / speed.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionQuality.Production
member.summary: Production quality, and generally produces similar results to normal, but it may double or triple the time to obtain minor quality improvements.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.CompressionQuality.Highest
member.summary: Best quality, slowest processing time. May be extremely slow as it brute force compressor and should generally only be used for testing purposes.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.Compression.RoundMode
member.summary: Enumerates options for if an image is resized so it's dimensions are a power of two.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.RoundMode.None
member.summary: No resizing.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.RoundMode.ToNextPowerOfTwo
member.summary: Dimensions are scaled up to the next power of two.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.RoundMode.ToNearestPowerOfTwo
member.summary: Dimensions are scaled up or down to nearest power of two depending on which is closer to the current dimension.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.RoundMode.ToPreviousPowerOfTwo
member.summary: Dimensions are scaled down to the previous power of two.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.RoundMode.ToNextMultipleOfFour
member.summary: Dimensions are scaled up to the next multiple of four.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.RoundMode.ToNearestMultipleOfFour
member.summary: Dimensions are scaled up or down to nearest multiple of four depending on which is closer the current dimension.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.Compression.RoundMode.ToPreviousMultipleOfFour
member.summary: Dimensions are scaled down to the previous multiple of four.

member.summary: Image's alpha data is used for transparency.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSContainer
member.summary: Represents a set of texture images that was loaded from a DDS file format. A number of texture types are supported, such as 1D, 2D, and 3D image data. Each collection represents a complete mipmap chain of a single face (e.g. 6 of these chains make up a cubemap). Most textures will just have a single mipmap chain.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSContainer.Dimension
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture dimension. Cubemaps must have six entries in .

member.name: P:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSContainer.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the texture format. All surfaces must have the same format.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSContainer.MipChains
member.summary: Gets the collection of mipmap chains. Typically there will be a single mipmap chain (sometimes just containing one image, if no mipmaps). Cubemaps must have six mipmap chains, and array textures may have any number.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the class.
member.param: Identifies the dimensions of the image data.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSContainer.Validate
member.summary: Validates the contained mipmap surfaces, e.g. all array main images must be the same dimensions and have the same number of mipmaps, cubemaps must have 6 faces, data/sizes must at least be in valid ranges, etc.
member.returns: True if the image data is not correctly initialized, false if it passes some basic checks.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.DDS.DXGIFormat.R9G9B9E5_SharedExp
member.summary: Three partial-precision floating-point numbers encoded into a single 32-bit value all sharing the same 5-bit exponent (variant of s10e5, which is sign bit, 10-bit mantissa, and 5-bit biased (15) exponent). There is no sign bit, and there is a shared 5-bit biased (15) exponent and a 9-bit mantissa for each channel.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.DDS.DXGIFormat.R8G8_B8G8_UNorm
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit unsigned-normalized-integer format. This packed RGB format is analogous to the UYVY format. Each 32-bit block describes a pair of pixels: (R8, G8, B8) and (R8, G8, B8) where the R8/B8 values are repeated, and the G8 values are unique to each pixel. Width must be even.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.DDS.DXGIFormat.G8R8_G8B8_UNorm
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit unsigned-normalized-integer format. This packed RGB format is analogous to the YUY2 format. Each 32-bit block describes a pair of pixels: (R8, G8, B8) and (R8, G8, B8) where the R8/B8 values are repeated, and the G8 values are unique to each pixel. Width must be even.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSFlags
member.summary: Flags for handling reading and writing DDS files.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSFlags.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSFlags.LegacyDword
member.summary: Assume pitch is DWORD aligned instead of BYTE aligned (used by some legacy DDS files due to incorrect assumptions).

member.name: F:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSFlags.NoR10B10G10A2Fixup
member.summary: When loading, do not use work around for long standing D3DX DDS file format issue which reversed the 10:10:10:2 color order masks.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSFlags.ForceRgb
member.summary: When loading, convert DXGI 1.1 BGR formats to RGB order to avoid use of optional WDDM 1.1 features.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSFlags.No16Bpp
member.summary: When loading, avoid usage of 5:6:5, 5:5:5:1, and 4:4:4:4 formats, instead expand them to 8:8:8:8 to avoid use of optional WDDM 1.2 features.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSFlags.NoPadding
member.summary: When loading, return image data without row/slice padding (e.g. strict pitch = width * bytes-per-pixel). When saving image data, it will always be padded based on the DDS Programming guide on MSDN ().

member.name: F:TeximpNet.DDS.DDSFlags.ForceExtendedHeader
member.summary: Always write the 'DX10' header extension when writing DDS files. Otherwise DX9 compatible DDS files will be attempted to be written, if the format permits it.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags
member.summary: Bitflags representing various options when loading from a variety of formats. The overlap between options is intentional. If the prefix differs from a given file format that is to be loaded, then that option will be ignored.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.Default
member.summary: Default loading procedure.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.GIF_Load256
member.summary: Loads the GIF as a 256 color image with unused palette entries, if it's 16 or 2 color.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.GIF_Playback
member.summary: "Play" the GIF to generate each frame (as 32bpp) instead of returning raw frame data when loading.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.ICO_MakeAlpha
member.summary: Convert to 32bpp and create an alpha channel from the AND-mask when loading.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.JPEG_Fast
member.summary: Load the JPEG file as fast as possible, sacrificing some quality.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.JPEG_Accurate
member.summary: Load the JPEG file with the best quality, sacrificing some speed.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.JPEG_CMYK
member.summary: Load the JPEG file with separated CMYK "as is".

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.JPEG_ExifRotate
member.summary: Load and rotate JPEG file according to Exif 'Orientation' tag if available.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.JPEG_Greyscale
member.summary: Load and convert JPEG file to an 8-bit greyscale image.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.PCD_Base
member.summary: Load PCD bitmap sized 768 x 512.

member.summary: Load PCD bitmap sized 384 x 256.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.PCD_BaseDiv16
member.summary: Load PCD bitmap sized 192 x 128.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.PNG_IgnoreGamma
member.summary: Avoid gamma correction when loading PNG files.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.RAW_Preview
member.summary: Try to load the RAW file's embedded JPEG preview with included Exif data or default to RGB 24-bit.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageLoadFlags.RAW_Display
member.summary: Try to load RAW as 24-bit RGB.

member.summary: When loading TARGA files, convert RGB555 and ARGB8888 to RGB888.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.ImageConversion
member.summary: Enumerates types of image conversions.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.To4Bits
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to 4 bits. If the bitmap was a high-color bitmap (16, 24, or 32-bit) or if it was a monochrome or greyscale bitmap (1 or 8-bit), the end result will be a greyscale bitmap, otherwise (1-bit palletised bitmaps) it will be a palletised bitmap.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.To8Bits
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to 8 bits. If the bitmap was a high-color bitmap (16, 24, or 32-bit) or if it was a monochrome or greyscale bitmap (1 or 4-bit), the end result will be a greyscale bitmap, otherwise (1-bit palletised bitmaps) it will be a palletised bitmap.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.To16Bits555
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to 16 bits, where each pixel has a color pattern of 5 bits red, 5 bits green, and 5 bits blue. One bit in each pixel is unused.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.To16Bits565
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to 16 bits, where each pixel has a color pattern of 5 bits red, 6 bits green, and 5 bits blue.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.To24Bits
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to 24 bits.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.To32Bits
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to 32 bits.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.ToGreyscale
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to an 8-bit greyscale image with a linear ramp.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.ToFloat
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to an array of 32-bit IEEE floating point values.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.ToUInt16
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to an array of unsigned 16-bit integers.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.ToRGBF
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to a 96-bit RGB float image, where 3 channels x 32-bit IEEE floating point.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.ToRGBAF
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to a 128-bit RGBA float image, where 4 channels x 32-bit IEEE floating point.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.ToRGB16
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to a 48-bit RGB image, where 3 channels x 16-bit.

member.name: F:TeximpNet.ImageConversion.ToRGBA16
member.summary: Converts a bitmap to a 64-bit RGBA image, where 4 channels x 16-bit.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.Surface
member.summary: Represents a 2D image surface. This object wraps a FreeImage bitmap.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Surface.IsLittleEndian
member.summary: Gets if the OS is little endian. If Big Endian, then surface data is RGBA. If little, then surface data is BGRA.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Surface.IsBGRAOrder
member.summary: Gets what color order the data in the surface will be stored at (this is coupled to endianness).
member.remarks: Note: This is based on the default compilation options for the FreeImage library. You can compile the library to use a hardcoded color order which we cannot detect. Make sure the native library is compiled with the default color order that is coupled to endianness.

member.name: P:TeximpNet.Surface.ColorOrder
member.summary: Gets a struct that contains further details about color order that FreeImage expects (this is coupled to endianness). Such information includes the default mask values that are used for 4-component color channels.
member.remarks: Note: This is based on the default compilation options for the FreeImage library. You can compile the library to use a hardcoded color order which we cannot detect. Make sure the native library is compiled with the default color order that is coupled to endianness.

member.name: T:TeximpNet.Unmanaged.UnmanagedLibraryResolver
member.summary: Resolves unmanaged DLLs for . The process is completely configurable, where the user can supply alternative library names (e.g. versioned libs), an override library name, and probing paths. These can be set for both 32/64 bit, or seperately for 32 or 64 bit. See for the search strategy.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Unmanaged.UnmanagedLibraryResolver.SetOverrideLibraryName32(System.String)
member.summary: Sets an override 32-bit library name. By default, the implementations creates a default name for the library, which is passed into for resolving. If the override is non-null, it will be used instead. This is useful if the library to be loaded is not conforming to the platform's default prefix/extension scheme (e.g. libXYZ.so on linux where "lib" is the prefix and ".so" the extension).
member.param: Null to clear, or override library name.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Unmanaged.UnmanagedLibraryResolver.SetOverrideLibraryName64(System.String)
member.summary: Sets an override 64-bit library name. By default, the implementations creates a default name for the library, which is passed into for resolving. If the override is non-null, it will be used instead. This is useful if the library to be loaded is not conforming to the platform's default prefix/extension scheme (e.g. libXYZ.so on linux where "lib" is the prefix and ".so" the extension).
member.param: Null to clear, or override library name.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Unmanaged.UnmanagedLibraryResolver.SetOverrideLibraryName(System.String)
member.summary: Sets an override 32-bit and 64-bit library name. By default, the implementations creates a default name for the library, which is passed into for resolving. If the override is non-null, it will be used instead. This is useful if the library to be loaded is not conforming to the platform's default prefix/extension scheme (e.g. libXYZ.so on linux where "lib" is the prefix and ".so" the extension).
member.param: Null to clear, or override library name.

member.name: M:TeximpNet.Unmanaged.UnmanagedLibraryResolver.ResolveLibraryPath(System.String)
member.summary:
Given a library name, this function attempts to resolve the file path from which it can be loaded. Each step of the search strategy uses the fallback library names if the given name was not found in the current step. If the search is unsuccessfully, the library name is returned which means the OS will try and do its own search strategy when attempting to load the library (this is dependent on the OS). The search strategy is the following, in order of execution:
Search user-specified probing paths.
Search {AppBaseDirectory}/runtimes/{RID}/native/.
Search {AppBaseDirectory}/.
Search nuget package path, e.g. {UserProfile}/.nuget/packages/{PackageId}/{PackageVersion}/runtimes/{RID}/native/.
The search strategy gives priority to user-specified probing paths, then local paths to the application, then finally examining the global nuget cache. The RID is the Runtime Identifier based on the platform/architecture, see also Microsoft's RID Catalog.
member.param: Name of the library to attempt to resolve.
member.returns: Full file path to the library, or the file name if not found (e.g. "libXYZ.so").
